boardgame.description: Among other things, Kamigami Battles: Into the Dreamlands contains six new gods and one new location for use with any Kamigami Battles standalone game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Kamigami Battles: Battle of the Nine Realms
Kamigami Battles: Rise of the Old Ones
Kamigami Battles: River of Souls

boardgame.name: City Control
boardgame.description:
City Control is a worker placement and area majority game where the aim is to have control of as many buildings in the city as possible.
The placement of workers allows combinations that can change the game.
To do this, you will have to send your teams into the buildings and gain influence on the eminent people
who are inside.
Whoever scores the most points wins. Points are earned by controlling buildings with your own teams.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kingdom Builder: Empire Edition
boardgame.description:
Supersize your Kingdom Builder experience with the Empire Edition.

This super-sized product includes custom shaped plastic houses with a different design for each player color, as well as 3D castles. In order to accommodate the larger houses, all of the player boards are 25% larger as well.

Additionally, the Empire Edition includes all new artwork on the box and cards, as well as bakelite location tokens.

Also includes The Emperor's Choice promo pack of "Twist" cards (first featured in Winter Kingdom) that can add a new rule to each game.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

boardgame.name: World Builder
boardgame.description:
Book 6: World Builder adds to the D100 Dungeon game a way to create and explore new and fascinating worlds. Your adventurer will travel the lands and interact with towns and cities, and explore a vast wilderness in search of adventure. They will find quests and side quests and may have events sprung on them as they explore. You have explored below, now its time to explore the above.

You will need the D100 Dungeon rule book to use this book.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Emerald Order
boardgame.description:
The Emerald Order is devoted to the guardianship and understanding of the mysteries of the Emerald Tablet, whereon the greatest arcane secrets of Thoth-Hermes are inscribed. The inner circle has divined the secrets of the tablets, enhancing their already formidable magical abilities with new understanding.

The Emerald Order for 5th Edition includes:


A new cultist subclass, the Emerald Order Initiate and Disciple of the Emerald Estorica
Fully detailed cult leaders, organization and goals with complete stats for 6 general levels of cultist plus specific leaders
Plots and adventure hooks for party levels 1 to 12, plus the Gyrfalcon Repository, an adventure locale ready to play


New magic items including an emerald shard ioun stone and the Emerald Tablets artifact

Two new monsters, the immured and the smaragdine golem, fully illustrated


Give your villains a little arcane boost, or give your players their own secret agenda. Show your players a new challenge with The Emerald Order for 5th Edition today!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Pleiades-Class Light Freighter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compact and ready to go!

Need a freighter? On a budget? We have the ship for you!

Smaller sister ship to the venerable Atlas-class, the Pleiades is a 300 tonne light freighter designed in competition to the Rucker-class. Perfect for a crew who are carrying cargo and campaigning through Earth Sector or Clement Sector!

This book features both the TL11 version of the Pleiades common in Clement Sector and the TL13 version often found in Earth Sector. Also featured is the Dustmote-class variant of the Pleiades designed to remain insystem and is shown here in both the TL11 version found in Clement Sector and the TL13 version found in Earth Sector.

The book fully details the ship with deckplans by Michael Johnson and beautiful art by Ian Stead.

Climb aboard!

boardgame.name: The Ageless Bones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Helm’s Grove is a peaceful trading town on a river, where nothing much ever happens. That is, unless it’s the start of Spring, when children disappear without a trace. Is it wolves? A curse? No one knows. But the truth of the town’s problems go back farther than anyone can imagine, and it’s up to your party to stop the ageless evil that is snatching up the town’s youth.

This adventure is compatible with the fifth edition ruleset, and is suitable for 4-6 characters of 1st or 2nd level.

boardgame.name: Machina Arcana: Ultimate Sleeve Set
boardgame.description:
Protect all of your Machina Arcana cards with this premium quality sleeve set. Contains enough sleeves for the Core game and its two expansions.

670 100 μm sleeves, 17.5×13×5 cm, 615 g


110 125×88 mm
80 59×91 mm
120 (2x) 80×45 mm
120 (2x) 45×68 mm


The smaller sleeves (80×45 and 45×68 mm) are lightly frosted on one side.

There was also an Expansion Sleeve Set of 170 sleeves, enough for one expansion (To Eternity or From Beyond).


40 125×88 mm
30 59×91 mm
60 80×45 mm
40 45×68 mm

boardgame.name: Atera Redux Journey 1: Our Lady of Chaos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Citizens of Arctun are mysteriously disappearing. An evil cult and internal political strife have set up shop inside the city walls, and a dark secret about the city's past threatens to reveal itself. Can you find out the truth and stop the cult before their Lady of Chaos enters our realm in this original adventure for 5e?

Classic monsters and a new BBEG team up for an enthralling story filled with political intrigue and plenty of opportunities for fighting. This full color adventure book comes with over 30 original maps detailing every area of the story, and over 50 color paintings of every NPC and monster.

boardgame.name: The Frost Spire
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

Long ago, when the world was new
an elf king was banished from his
kingdom and tossed into the sea.
His hatred was so great, and so cold
that it froze the water into a tall spire
and he was cursed to drift forever
bringing Winter to the world.
But sometimes, he hungers for the
blood of bad children.
And on nights, when the fog is
thick, and the ice piles up in jagged
sheets upon the shore, he sends his
wives to steal away crying babies,
and the kinds of children that fight
and do not do what they’re told.
So beware sweet voices in the fog,
and stay close to the fire, or you
might be carried off, howling to the
frost spire.

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Fallen Cult
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Devil Waits Among The Dead

The cult of the devil lords has fallen, and their temple disappeared along with them, punished by the fiends for imprisoning one of their kind. The crypts where the temple once was fell apart, and only the dead roam them now... The dead and the devil, waiting, imprisoned, for someone to cross the threshold once more.

Open the Crypt of the Fallen Cult where the worshipers of evil once performed their wicked rituals and uncover the truth about the cult's sudden disappearance. Did forces of good wipe them out... or did one of their deals with the devil turned to be more than they bargained for?

Crypt of the Fallen Cult is a one-shot dungeon crawl for parties at level 3 (or 5) for the 5th and 3.5 editions! Featuring new monsters and multitude of puzzles and obstacles for players to overcome, it can be easily dropped in into any urban or horror-themed adventure as a point of interest.

Contents
A dungeon crawl ready to be dropped in any urban or horror-themed adventure, with several leads
2 new maps (with walls, lights - and all monsters already placed in correct positions in VTT editions)
3 new monsters, with custom tokens

boardgame.name: Reverie Knights Tactics
boardgame.description:
Reverie Knights Tactics is a turn-based tactical RPG with strategic battles in isometric grids where every decision you make can alter the story and the way you configure the characters.

Embark on an expedition to find Lennorien, the long lost elvian city to save your loved ones, while fighting the goblin menace that spread terror across the continent!

Lead your party of heroes, each one with distinct, special abilities and skills, allowing you to use multiple battle strategies to defeat your enemies.

Discover a fantasy world featuring deep map and scenario exploration in an epic adventure, visual novel style!

Craft new items and accessories from the treasures you collect and use them as tactical advantage every time you configure your characters.

Key Features:
● Beautiful Hand Drawn Art: Meticulous multilayer artwork from pencil sketch to full detail color.
● Decision-driven Storyline: Make several decisions through your quests, affecting the story and other characters` reactions.
● Character Customization: Customize character`s performance attributes, skills, and accessories for heightened abilities!
● Item Crafting: Collect powerful items as you explore the world and discover combinations to create new items.
● Exploration: Travel your way through an expansive map, unlocking secret quests, solving puzzles, and exploring scenarios and evil dungeons!
● Up to Four Hero Characters: Control 4 different heroes, each one with distinct, special abilities and skills, allowing multiple battle strategies.
● Battle Phases: React to your opponent's strategy and come up with the perfect tactic every turn, challenging you to think ahead.
● Interactive Battle Scenarios: Manipulate parts of the battle environments, and use scenario effects to your advantage!
● Multiple Battle Grids: Each battle contains a different isometric grid, making every battle an unique experience.

boardgame.name: DC Deck-Building Game: Injustice
boardgame.description: DC Deck-Building Game: Injustice puts you in the world of the hit Injustice: Gods Among Us video games and comics as Batman and his insurgents battle against a tyrannical Superman. Using the Brawl version of the Cerberus Engine, players land devastating blows and block their opponents' strikes. The Kickstarter Exclusive cover is by renowned artist Well-Bee (Marvels X, The No Ones) and the game cards feature extraordinary art by six talented artists from Altercomics.net as well as directly from the Injustice comics.

boardgame.name: DC Deck-Building Game: Rivals – The Flash vs Reverse-Flash
boardgame.description: DC Deck-Building Game: Rivals – The Flash vs Reverse-Flash makes you part of the high-speed battle between iconic rivals. Each player has three unique Character cards, each with more formidable abilities and a higher cost than the previous one. Players use the cards in their hands and special abilities like "Speedster" to buy cards and confront each other with the ultimate goal of defeating your foe three times. Each time a character is defeated, they gain new abilities and become more difficult to overcome.

boardgame.name: Aero Flights
boardgame.description:
This race game commemorates the 1909 flight from France to England by aviator Louis Bieriot and offers players the chance to make the return trip. Players compete as aviators to cross the English channel using a single die and a board made up of small square spaces.

If players roll 1, 2, 3, or 4, they may move that number of spaces in any direction they choose. Rolling 5 or 6 compels them to use a compass-styled spinner to determine which direction they will go. Two planes that would land on the same space must compete by rolling the die; the winning higher number keeps the space, while the loser drops south by the number of spaces rolled.

Planes that would go off the edge into the "sky" cannot move that turn. Planes that fall in the sea must go back to the start. Planes that hit the cliffs on either side of the board are eliminated outright!

The winner is the first pilot to land their aircraft "on one of the squares of the Finish." They may overshoot the winning roll without negative consequence.

boardgame.name: Diamond Keepers
boardgame.description:
Diamond Keepers is a four to six player tabletop turn based card game, where each player takes the role of the protector of a kingdom and their most valuable resource Diamonds.

The legend says that the one who possesses one diamond from each kingdom will rule the world.

This game is turned based, and in each turn the players can use different types of cards to either steal other player diamonds, protect themselves or their allies, or even alter the flow of the match.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marks of Legend: The Spire of Deren'nuk
boardgame.description:
In this solitaire storytelling bookmark game, craft a legend from the pages of a book!

Choose a place in any book, and search for words on those pages to fill the blanks of a heroic legend, chapter by chapter. The words you use affect which words you must find to perform a series of feats. Perform every feat before you run out of words to finish your legend.

This game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In-Hand Game Design Contest.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Carbon Grey
boardgame.description:
The return of the D6 System by West End Games!
Survive the grimness of trench warfare. Dare to soar the deadly skies. Master the art of espionage to uncover the secrets of your enemies. Navigate the social hierarchy and underhanded dealings of both the nobility and the underworld. Learn to manipulate the strange powers that affect the very reality of the world around you. This is CARBON GREY.

Built on the time-tested legacy of the D6 System by seminal developer West End Games, players will be able to dive into the world of CARBON GREY quickly and easily through the new "Magnetic Variant (D6MV)" Rule Set. Taking full advantage of the unique and popular “Wild Die” feature, adventures in CARBON GREY will be as thrilling and cinematic as players dare to imagine.

This Core Rule Book is designed to introduce you to the world of Carbon Grey and the Magnetic Variant of the West End Games D6 System ruleset. It also includes an introductory adventure and some pre-generated characters to quick play. For the full force action of this war-torn world, you'll want to get your hands on the Deluxe Boxed Set Edition featuring 21 detailed miniatures (between 32-90mm), 24x36" battle maps, 140 enemy and asset cards, dozens of tokens and map markers, custom D6MV dice in three unique colors, and a sturdy casebound GM screen.

The Core Rule Book features twenty-four unique character archetypes, gifting you with talents and abilities you choose to make your presence unique and indispensable to uncovering – and perhaps stopping – the hidden machinations manipulating world events. Navigate the treacherous water of nobility as a Sovereign or Free Lady. Silence opposition as a deadly Royal Operative or Reluctant Mentor. Own the battlefield as a Trench Fighter or rule the skies as a Dogfighter. Navigate the underworld as a Moonlighter or Master Spy. Or walk the edge of reality as a mystical Dharman Adept or sentient Fenris Wolf.

With over 50 enemy and monster types to encounter, there is much to discover in the world of Carbon Grey...

The Carbon Grey Role-playing Game is the first to use the Magnetic Variant (D6MV) of the classic D6 System tabletop role-playing game rules by West End Games, rewinding the system back to its classic roots and streamlining it for a modern audience.

Rules variations unique to the Magnetic Variant of the system include Genre Defined Attributes, Streamlined Skills, and Character Quirks and Obligations.

Space/time in Carbon Grey is bent—apply too much pressure and it will snap. We’ve added a special Wild Die to represent this element of chaos to the game—chaos that can cause Continuity Surges, Flux Effects, and more.

This 14-page Settings Primer will introduce you to the world of CARBON GREY and prepare you for the Quickstart Guide and Complete Rulebook release to follow.

boardgame.name: Carbon Grey Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
The return of the D6 System by West End Games!
Survive the grimness of trench warfare. Dare to soar the deadly skies. Master the art of espionage to uncover the secrets of your enemies. Navigate the social hierarchy and underhanded dealings of both the nobility and the underworld. Learn to manipulate the strange powers that affect the very reality of the world around you. This is CARBON GREY.

Built on the time-tested legacy of the D6 System by seminal developer West End Games, players will be able to dive into the world of CARBON GREY quickly and easily through the new "Magnetic Variant (D6MV)" Rule Set. Taking full advantage of the unique and popular “Wild Die” feature, adventures in CARBON GREY will be as thrilling and cinematic as players dare to imagine.

This Quickstart Guide offers a condensed and simplified version of the full game. It is designed to introduce you to the world of Carbon Grey and the Magnetic Variant of the West End Games D6 System ruleset. It also includes an introductory adventure and some pre-generated characters to play. For the full force action of this war-torn world, you'll need the Carbon Grey Role-Playing Game Core Rulebook or Deluxe Boxed Set Edition to be released in January 2022.

The full game will feature twenty-four unique character archetypes, gifting you with talents and abilities you choose to make your presence unique and indispensable to uncovering – and perhaps stopping – the hidden machinations manipulating world events. Navigate the treacherous water of nobility as a Sovereign or Free Lady. Silence opposition as a deadly Royal Operative or Reluctant Mentor. Own the battlefield as a Trench Fighter or rule the skies as a Dogfighter. Navigate the underworld as a Moonlighter or Master Spy. Or walk the edge of reality as a mystical Dharman Adept or sentient Fenris Wolf.

With over 50 enemy and monster types to encounter, there is much to discover in the world of Carbon Grey...

The Carbon Grey Role-playing Game is the first to use the Magnetic Variant (D6MV) of the classic D6 System tabletop role-playing game rules by West End Games, rewinding the system back to its classic roots and streamlining it for a modern audience.

Rules variations unique to the Magnetic Variant of the system include Genre Defined Attributes, Streamlined Skills, and Character Quirks and Obligations.

Space/time in Carbon Grey is bent—apply too much pressure and it will snap. We’ve added a special Wild Die to represent this element of chaos to the game—chaos that can cause Continuity Surges, Flux Effects, and more.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Foes & Factions
boardgame.description:
They say knowing your enemy and the battlefield before the fight can mean the difference between victory and defeat. Expand your knowledge of the Carbon Grey Universe by adding the Foes and Factions within to your game. This book is filled with world lore and even more stats for allies and foes. Now your favorite PCs can interact with characters made famous from the Carbon Grey Graphic Novel. Foes & Factions contains 14 iconic characters, 15 new NPC types, 4 new Axis Powers, 14 locations of interest, an espionage mission generator, and 8 new Groups, Factions, and Forces to add to your the Carbon Grey RPG campaign. This book uses the D6MV Magnetic Variant of the classic West End Games D6 System and requires the Carbon Grey Role Playing Game Core Rulebook to play.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Badge of Blood
boardgame.description:
No GM? No problem. In this exciting Solo Play adventure for the Carbon Grey Role Playing Game, you take on the role of an operative chosen for a death-defying mission. It will take all your skill, cunning, and a bit of luck to pull it off. Do you have what it takes to earn your Badge of Blood, or will you be just another casualty in an ever-waging war? Badge of Blood uses the D6MV Magnetic Variant of the West End Games D6 System and requires the Carbon Grey RPG Core Rulebook to play. Unlike a full RPG group session, in Solo Play the adventure text and random dice rolls take the place of the game master. All the actions and decisions fall upon you!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Spyrol
boardgame.description:
This is a race game for 2 or 4 players, with some aspects of both Ludo and Snakes and Ladders. As in Ludo, the goal is for each player to get all four of their counters to the Home space, in this case the very center of a long spiral. Counters of different colors may capture each other, while two or more counters of the same color may form a Barrier that cannot be captured or passed.

There are also seven Ladders set on the board to reach across rings of the spiral. A counter which lands at the base of a Ladder will shoot to the other end, capturing any opposing piece in the Ladder's path.

The game may be based on the older and more complex Willy's Walk to see Grandmamma, which features a similar layout.

boardgame.name: Carbon Grey Omnibus
boardgame.description:
To a noble family twins are born; Mathilde and Giselle, the Sisters Grey.

For generations, the Sisters have protected and counseled the Kaiser, ruler of Mitteleuropa. But this is a different time. At the birth of the industrial age a great war is raging. When the Kaiser is assassinated Giselle is accused.

Pursued by her sisters and hunted by the enemy Giselle must unravel the prophecy of the Carbon Grey before history itself is rewritten.

The complete collected edition of the sold-out graphic novel series by Hoang Nguyen, Paul Gardner, Khari Evans, and Kinsun Loh, originally published by Image Comics, is remastered to support the expanded universe established for the new CARBON GREY RPG by Magnetic Press Play.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Carbon Grey Character Sheets
boardgame.description:
Printable character sheets for use with the CARBON GREY RPG.
File includes full color and toner-friendly versions in both full-page and half-page layouts.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Campaign Creator Deck
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
The Campaign Creator deck aids in the creation of campaign and quest structures. Randomly generate concepts and themes by drawing cards when writing up a new campaign or story. Quest, Interlude, Theme and Story cards can be laid out and connected to create unique campaign concepts. Roll six sided dice and place them on the cards, and flip coins, to add even more nuance to each card drawn.

The Campaign Deck can be used in multiple ways. Shuffle and draw cards, placing them beside one another, to create a string of events that will guide you when planning gaming sessions. Once you have drawn and placed your cards, try to think how adjacent cards can flow together and affect one another. The titles of the cards can be taken literally, or simply used as inspiration for campaign content.

boardgame.name: Leopard Women of Venus! (DCC)
boardgame.description:
Inject delirious sci-fi thrills into your game sessions with Leopard Women of Venus, a Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG setting book inspired by the works of Golden Age comic book artist Fletcher Hanks! Journey to Venus, a tropical hell-planet inhabited by four human factions. In addition to fending off the endlessly lethal flora and fauna, they must also keep watch for invaders from other worlds and the constant threat of betrayal by the other factions. Can even the mighty Leopard Women prevent humanity’s extinction?

Leopard Women of Venus!


Three new patrons, complete with spells! (Stardust the Super Wizard, Fantomah, and SPANDO)
Leopard Woman class
100 Venusian occupations
Sci-fi weapons and gear
Bestiary full of monsters, aliens, and antagonists
“Saucer Full of Secrets” (0-Level funnel)
“Mine of the Moglugs” (Level-1 adventure)
The Marvelous Moglug Maker
And so much more!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Three Kobolds in a Trenchcoat
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
You are three (or more) kobolds in a trenchcoat. Working together, you are trying to pass off as human.

You have a specific thing you're trying to do. You win if you do it. You lose if you get caught being kobolds.

boardgame.name: Argos2022 Space Backpack + R05Y-J
boardgame.description:
A space adventure in 2 parts and in solo : 2 r'n'w that will propel you on Argos to try to terraform the planet and a trip to its moon R05Y-J to search for traces of life.
Each r'n'w is a standalone but in the same universe. You can play Argos than R05Y-J to an excited journey.
Roll 4 dice, check the damages on your ship, try to exctract hydrogen and ore to activate modules, Argos it's a little bit maths but a lot of stress.

boardgame.name: I Would Destroy The Ring
boardgame.description:
A nerdy expansion deck. From space odysseys to long walks through magical lands, this deck brings you 200 exclusive cards that you won't find anywhere else and can be played as a stand-alone.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: I Would Kill Hitler: The Party Game
I Would Kill Hitler: The Party Game

listing.notes: Title: I Would Destroy The Ring Publisher: Self Published Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Catherine: The Cities of the Tsarina
Katharina: Die Städte der Zarin
boardgame.description:
Catherine: The Cities of the Tsarina takes 2-4 players to the Tsarist Empire of 1762 to win the Tsarina's favor with the help of an innovative card mechanism. As is so often the case, different strategies can lead to different goals: Do you devote yourself to the development of the fine arts or trade, or do you perhaps prefer to secure arms and thus perpetuate the empire? With each card you hold, you must decide whether to gain the resources and use the action on that card or whether to throw it away to activate another action.

To start the game, choose three of the six project cards in your hand and place them in your action row. At the top of each project card is a list of three cities or an assortment of cannons, books, and goods; at the bottom of each project card is an action and (in most cases) a bonus.

The game lasts three decades, with each decade lasting four rounds. Players play simultaneously during each round. At the start of a round, draw two cards, then play one card in your action row and another card in your activation row — located below your action row — under any project card in your action row that has not been activated. If the activation card matches the color of the action card above it, you carry out that action, whether it's placing a residence on the map, gaining cards, exchanging cards for points or a favor, gaining favor by having cannons or books, etc. If you carried out the action and the card has a bonus, you then get that bonus once. If the activation card doesn't match in color or you choose not to do the action, you draw a project card as compensation.

If you would ever draw cards over your hand limit, you instead gain 1 point for each such card. If you would gain favor over the maximum, you instead gain 1 point.

After four rounds, an interim scoring takes place, with players comparing cannons and books in their action row, then gaining points for residences and their placement on the favor track. Players then discard all cards in their activation row, along with the cards above them that were activated, then draw two new cards. After the third interim scoring, players score points for cards in hand, their largest group of contiguous residences, and how well they've completed the order card they received at the start of play. To complete orders, you need goods from cities, which means you need to place residences in those cities, which means you need to activate the right cards and collect lots of books.

Whatever you do, do your best to make Catherine proud!

Title: Katharina - die Stadte der Zarin Publisher: DLP Games Language(s): English German

boardgame.name: Gray Eminence: Custom Card Holder
boardgame.description: Custom Card Holder for five different card decks

boardgame.name: Factory 42: "Pimp My Ride" luxury carts
boardgame.description:
Set of 6 luxury carts made of resin

These lovely composite resin carts have the same dimensions as the cardboard carts, fitting perfectly on the gameboard.
Obviously, the use of this kind of traitorous luxury item is shunned by the government and every good commissar would report the use to higher authorities… and likely confiscate these for their own use. So, caution is advisable. If the next table playing the same game doesn’t happen to have these, the use of only modest gloating is recommended.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arawn's Challenge
boardgame.description:
You find yourself in the land of the dead, fighting your way back to the world of the living. Bargain with the Ambassador to the 18 courts of Hell, face the judges of the dead, battle Garan the Fallen and riddle with the skeletal sphinx, and only then will you be worthy of Arawn's Challenge.

This adventure allows the judge to restart a campaign after a TPK. Arawn's Challenge is a third level adventure compatible with the DCC RPG, but can easily be adjusted for any level.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Манчкин: Гравити Фолс
boardgame.description:
This is the best summer in your life, Munchkin! A small town in Oregon holds many secrets for you to discover.
Choose from 10 favorite characters like Dipper, Wendy or Old Man McGucket and go on an adventure. Dangerous monsters are waiting for you, from annoying gnomes to the insidious Bill Cipher and his team from the Nightmare Dimension. Call your true friends Candy, Courageous Dan and Lazy Susan for help, arm yourself with Nyarf, Owl Scoop and Electric Gloves, fill your pockets with Fairy Dust and Smiles - then no curses will be afraid of you!

Манчкин: Гравити Фолс ("Munchkin: Gravity Falls") introduces a new type of card into the game - mystery cards. Each mystery card will give you two useful abilities, but keep in mind that monsters and other munchkins will not let you use them easily!

boardgame.name: Suspects 2
boardgame.description:
Suspects 2 is a range of investigation games with streamlined rules and plots centered on the psychology of the characters in the style of Agatha Christie’s novels.
This is the second opus.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #17 - Apr 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magical items like the coffer of riches, heretic's bane, owlbear dander, and zombie skin shield!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like castellan's call, dispel silence, stolen valor, and stronghold sanctuary!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the oozemancer, college of spies, and circle of worked stone!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the charming leaf leshy, the cruel frosty chiseler, and the beatific bliss dragon!

boardgame.name: The Fog of Waymoor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the remote swamp town of Waymoor. After spending a night here, adventurers are greeted by an imposing wall of shifting fog that smells of death and decay, which threatens not only the characters but the entire town. Through a combination of investigation and role playing, characters uncover a dark conspiracy and curse behind the fog. The adventure concludes with a harrowing encounter in an ancient crypt deep within the marsh, where the party must seal away the evil forces that assault the town.

This adventure is intended to be played by four-to-six characters of 3rd or 4th level, and is compatible with fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons.

boardgame.name: Van Ryan's Vault
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Van Ryan’s Vault begins as a heist story that becomes a dungeon delve into a series of caves in a geothermal hotspot below the fictional city of Kierkegaard. But the PCs are not the only ones after the treasure, and there are many dangers down in the depths of the caverns.

Instead of verbose descriptions, whenever possible descriptive "tags" have been used to expedite running the game for the GM. While the first half of the adventure involves a heist requiring a number of social encounters, the second half is a dungeon crawl through subterranean caverns. For the dungeon crawl section, we've included ten "Encounter Cards" that can be printed and cut out for the GM to layout the caverns right at the table. Each card tells what is encountered in that section of the caverns and gives the corresponding page number in the module where more information is needed.

The Contents of this product include:

19-page adventure text

10 "Encounter Cards" to deal out while the PCs explore the caverns. Some encounters are repeatable.

Stats for Throwing Axes & Horse Pistols

2-pages featuring 6 sample PCs so you can dive right into the adventure. These sample characters have 20 Advancement Points incorporated into their builds.

Guidelines on how to run a Tavern Brawl.

boardgame.name: Unearthed Adventures Volume: III
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Includes 6 fifth edition one-page adventures that are designed to be modular. What does that mean? It means that you can easily toss them into an existing setting, regardless of its theme. As the Game Master you can choose to make them short side quests from your normal game, run them as a one-shot, or add content to extend them to a full adventure. While the encounters and situations are set up to be a complete story, you can add additional rooms, characters, or encounters to each one to twist and shape it to best fit your GM style. You can easily change out the monsters and trap damage listed in the adventures with something similar that is level appropriate to the party. If you are unsure, consult the table in the DMG on pg 274. It provides the damage ranges appropriate to challenge rating levels.

boardgame.name: The Third Parallel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ALL LINED UP
Your eyes have to be everywhere. In front. In back. On the Matrix. On the astral. Threats come from every possible direction and dimension, and runners who don’t keep an eye on every possible danger end up falling to the one they neglected.

The threats are lined up in Denver, a city ruled by a dragon and home to one of the greatest outlaw tech archives in the world. Shadows are aligning and plots are fomenting, and shadowrunners have the chance to learn what’s happening in enough time to make some nuyen and save a few lives—including their own.

boardgame.name: Color Addict Puzzle
boardgame.description:
In this dominoes-like variant of Color Addict, players must lay out their cards so that the edges match the color patterns on cards that have already been played. If a player is unable to act on his turn, he draws one of the "joker" black and white cards.

The goal is to be the first player to get rid of all of his cards.

boardgame.name: Chakravyuha: Trading Card Game
boardgame.description:
Chakravyuha Trading Card Game (TCG) is a battle strategy game that is inspired by ancient Indian texts of Mahabharata, Ramayana, and Puranas.

Ancient texts from India are filled with stories of Yodhas (legendary warriors) with extraordinary skills and strength that they had acquired through Education (Shiksha), Practice (Sadhana), and Penance (Tapasya).

Equipped with Vardaans (divine blessings) and Astras (divine weapons of incomparable strengths) these Yodhas elevated themselves to the level of Rathi (5000 times stronger than a Yodha); Atirathi (12 times stronger than a Rathi), or Maharathi (12 times stronger than an Atirathi). So a Maharathi has the strength of 720,000 Yodhas!

However, some Yodhas were also weakened by curses (Shraaps) by divinities that these warriors had wronged through their actions (Karma).

In Chakravyuha TCG, you command an army (Sena) of Yodhas and strengthen them with Astras and Vardaans while weakening the opposing army with Shraaps and other effects of your superhuman warriors and their weapons.

Chakravyuha Trading Card Game (TCG) is a battle strategy game that is inspired by this part of the ancient Indian texts. In this game, you as a General command an army (Sena) of Yodhas and strengthen them with Astras and Vardaans while weakening the opposing army with Shraaps and other effects of your superhuman warriors and their weapons.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Gello Grotto
boardgame.description:
From publisher blub:

The job takes a strange job from the Baker's Guild. Apparently, a Gelatinous Cube in the sewer was recently slain. The 'monster' was responsible for cleaning the sewer area and keeping the smell down. The party must head north along the coastline and find a cave where the creature was originally captured and bring another back in its place!

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for five, third level adventurers.

boardgame.name: Mechanisms
boardgame.description:
Mechanisms is a game of moving tiles and scoring points.

Players compete to add points to their own towers and keep points away from their opponents. Each turn, players use 1-3 action cards to move tiles and cards around the play space.

In addition to the actions they take on their own turn, players may place Chain tokens on cards they have previously played to take additional actions during opponent turns.

Finally, players gain access to various upgrades, including deckbuilding, whenever someone draws a tile from the top of their tower. Each round players must weigh whether to take an early upgrade or wait for a larger draw and, thus, a better upgrade.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Grey
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A party of adventurers is contacted by an alchemist to end a horrific blight plaguing the Kingdom of Aevum in this classic medieval fantasy adventure for 3-5 Seasoned heroes.

boardgame.name: Blood of the Guilty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blood of the Guilty is a one-shot adventure balanced for four 6th level characters, and is written and designed by Matthew Koentjoro (Dungeon Glitch), an Indonesian and Native American TTRPG desinger, bringing heavy influences of his culture to the adventure.

Called to a village to help the people deal with a years-long draught, the party finds a fearsome creature murdering the elders and citizens. Can they investigate the clues and find the culprit behind the killings? They may even find a cure for the drought in the process!

boardgame.name: Wrath and Redemption
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wrath and Redemption is a one-shot adventure balanced for four 6th level characters, and is written and designed by Matthew Koentjoro (Dungeon Glitch), an Indonesian and Native American TTRPG desinger, bringing heavy influences of his culture to the adventure.

When a Paladin is determined to exterminate the followers of a necromantic god, can the party discover the true nature of the god's relationship with mortals and protect the priests against the unbridled passion of the paladin? Wrath and Redemption is an Indonesian story about the balance of justice and mercy, and the cost of redeeming one's own mistakes.

boardgame.name: The Formidable 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Formidable Four, a team of superhuman villains forever changed by their alien abductors bent on spreading chaos and fear across the globe. The Formidable Four's vast powers and experience working together makes them a deadly team on the top of every law-enforcement group's most wanted list.

The Formidable Four PDF contains...
Detailed backgrounds on the team's history as well as for each team member
Plot hooks for involving the entire team as well as for each character
The tactics each member prefers to use
A collection of Supporting Cast characters that can be used to add more flavor to encounters with the Formidable Four
Maps of the Formidable Four's subterranean headquarters.
Fold-Up Characters of all four members of the FF included!

boardgame.name: The Swamp Daughters of Marshsund
boardgame.description:
The people of Marshsund have allied with strange powers, but for almost a hundred years nobody bothered investigating. Now the daughter of a powerful lord has gone missing in the Dystermarsh, and he is looking to you for help. Can your players unravel the mystery of the Swamp Daughters and find a solution in time?
This adventure was made for use with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game and requires the rulebook to play. For use with characters of level 3 or higher.

Includes:


A dungeon map by Dyson Logos.
A hex crawl map of the southern Dystermarsh, two more for easier use in the digital edition.
Encounter tables for the surrounding regions.
Several factions the players can interact with.
A full chapter on the town of Marshsund and NPCs to interact with there.
Several new monsters.
Additional rules for outdoor survival.
Lots of OGL content for reuse in your own works.


- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The Headless Horseman
boardgame.description:
There was supposed to be a wedding, but then a headless horseman killed the groom, abducted the bride-to-be and slaughtered a farmhand. Something is afoot, but it is beyond mere farmers to undo the threat and find out what happened to the girl. Will your players step up to face danger? And what will they find?

This product is compatible with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. It is designed to be played with characters of level 2.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Mastro Alice
boardgame.description:
The game was conceived by Aldo Spinelli in 1989 and develops on a chessboard of 4 squares per side.
Each player has a traditional six-sided die, which is moved from one square to another in an orthogonal direction, rotating on an edge of his choice as many times as the value expressed by the top face.
The dice can change direction after each rotation and can also retrace the squares already traveled during the same move. The die can only pass into empty squares.
The player who manages to finish his move in the square occupied by the opponent wins, so that, after the last rotation, his die shows on the upper face a value identical to that indicated at that moment by the upper face of the enemy die.

boardgame.name: The Stars are Falling
boardgame.description:
Destiny calls, Adventurers!

Forgotten tombs, ancient laboratories, the decadent palace of the God of Dreams, plundered and dusty dwarven holdfasts, and the ferociously defended territories of the Herders and Hounds of the Stars themselves!

There are mysteries to be solved within these pages, crafty and horrific enemies to defeat, and treasures both monetary and magical to claim for your own. Pray to your gods, strap on your shield, and sharpen your knives: The Stars are Falling, and it is up to you to stop them-and make a little coin on the way...

Purple Duck Games' Adventure Locales One through Five for Dungeon Crawl Classics are here packaged with an intriguing framework story to take you on a story arc of wonder and fun for characters levels 1 to 3.

Dare you stop the stars from falling?

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Netsvis
boardgame.description:
The game is inspired by the Etruscan divination art and is an interpretation of how dice could have been used more than 2500 years ago.
The Netsvis board reproduces the sacred Etruscan space and can be used both alone, to draw the wishes of the day, and in competition with other players, having as its objective the challenge to Fate with the simple throw of the dice.
How to play.

Netsvis is a solitaire where you face pure destiny, destiny and what governs all the daily events behind it. It can be used as a divination tool (do I win or does Fate win?) But it is also a competitive pastime towards oneself. In fact, it is possible to numerically evaluate the outcome of the single game and gradually try to obtain better and better results. In this way it is also possible to compete with the participation of more players in succession of time.
The two dice act alternately as dice and checkers. The white die W is favorable, the one that could win. The black die B is the unfavorable one, the one that could make you lose.
At the start of the game, B is placed in the gray box in the lower center. It doesn't matter what value is shown on the top face of him.
You roll W with your right hand and, starting from the square occupied by B, advance it to the right to the first square that shows the same image of the face that came out in the roll of the dice. Here the die W stops while B remains in his place.
Now take B and throw it with your left hand. The result of the shot causes B to move to the first square corresponding to the exit face, starting from the position of W but in the opposite direction, ie to the left. Now two clarifications are necessary. The first, completely connected to superstition, is linked to the traditional beneficial influence of the right hand (which must be used to roll the white dice) while the left has always been considered a bearer of misfortune. The second clarification is fundamental for the purposes of the game. When the rule says: "Bring B into the first square on the left starting from the one occupied by W" it means that a possible release of the colors magenta, yellow or blue in this first throw of B will make it move to the right with respect to its initial position but " however "to the left of the white die.
After placing B in the corresponding square, W is taken from the square in which it is and raised (with the right hand) and then moved to the right up to the first square equal to the exit face. Also in this case the reference to the starting point of the displacement of W is the square in which B stands.
And so on, toss after toss in a continuous back and forth that leads W to the right arm of the board and brings B back to the left. The game continues until one of the two dice cannot move because it is in such a position that there is no square in front of it with the symbol that came out in that roll. If it is W, it is placed on the top white square and the player has won.
If it is B, it is moved to the top black box and the player has lost. So it's fate that won the game!
You can only win with an odd number of rolls and lose with an even number. This distinction also has its own symbolic meaning ... And you can win with a few moves or after a tiring sequence of rolling the two dice. Likewise, if Fate is adverse, a few moves may be enough to reach the nefarious black box. If you manage to stall, you must never lose hope: the arrangement of the numbers on the board can often turn the tables in our favor.

boardgame.name: The Mystery of Brushgather Farm (PF2)
boardgame.description:
Usable as a standalone adventure to play in 1-2 sessions, or as a side quest in the epic Dark Obelisk Adventure Path, The Mystery of Brushgather Farm is usable with any adventuring party of any level.

A simple farmstead is comprised of a small family of halflings. But when one sister runs away from home and a second goes missing, the third and only remaining child ventures forth to discover what happened to her siblings.

Alone and wracked with guilt and worry, the farm matriarch turns cruel and abusive, and the father seeks comfort in delving ever deeper into the caverns and tunnels underneath the farmhouse... until one day, drawn to the burgeoning evil of the corrupted psyches of the grief-stricken parents, terror and gore seizes what was once a simple farm.

A Complete Adventure... And Much More!

Mystery of Brushgather Farm contains everything you need to run it. In true Infinium Game Studio form, this means what may have been a simple 20-page adventure is instead over 140 pages of richly-detailed content.

This includes:


Redacted, Player Handout versions of each and every map.
A full mini-Bestiary of every monster referenced in the adventure: 27 monsters, each with 4 complete statblocks, for a total of more than 100 statblocks.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Spellstorm
boardgame.description:
A tactical deckbuilder for 1-4 players.

Spiritual sequel to Dragon Bridge. Set in the Gem Wizards Universe, which also includes the videogame Gem Wizards Tactics. As in these other games, SPELLSTORM features the ninja bug Omar Evans, the business demon intern Derby Pocket, radical activist skeleton Eve Williams, plus a bunch of new fun characters.

In Spellstorm, 1-4 wizards do battle on a 1x18 grid, bumping each other back and forth. Bump the enemy into the Dragon to deal damage, and reduce their health to zero to win!

Take turns drafting cards from an ever-changing market to their decks. They use these spell cards to BUMP each other

Choose from 8 wildly asymmetrical characters with their own unique magical powers. Will you win by having a strong economy, purchasing powerful Star Cards? Or rush them down with red Fire cards? Or slowly chip away at them using Ice cards to have them slip into the Dragon's maw?

In the one player and cooperative modes, face off against one of four monsters, each of whom brings their own challenge to the game.

You can also play in two on two team battles, or 3-4 player FFA matches! Spellstorm is a game that's easy to learn but takes years to master all of its systems.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Thing: Human Miniatures Set 2
boardgame.description:
The Thing – The Boardgame is an intense game experience for 1-8 players based on the 1982 cult movie directed by John Carpenter. It is a game that mixes different mechanics to create an experience that is as faithful as possible to that of the original movie.

The Thing: Human miniatures expansion contains a set of four highly detailed character miniatures, to use in place of the Characters standees you can find into the base game box.

These miniatures represent 4 of second characters seen in the movie, such as Copper or Palmer.

Using these Character miniatures in place of the standees enriches the game, giving it a more scenic aspect and a stronger impact to the gameplay.

boardgame.name: FlexTale Environmental Encounters
boardgame.description:
Do you struggle with ho-hum wandering monster tables? Do you find yourself--as a D/GM or as a player--dreading any time you have to roll on a random encounter table?

Never fear: the Environmental Encounters tool ensures that you'll rarely have the same encounter twice while on the road between points of interest!

Zero Prep, System-Agnostic
Designed to be immediately usable in any fantasy TTRPG, Environmental Encounters requires zero prep time.
No prep time? No problem! Just find the right table that matches the terrain you're moving through on the map, and roll. FlexTale Environmental Encounters will take care of the rest, no matter what your experience level as a D/GM.

What is This Thing?

The FlexTale Environmental Encounters book is 85 pages of richly-detailed tables and tools designed to make random encounters better.

More interesting for players. Easier to run for D/GMs.

And above all: NOT BORING!

How to Use This Book

It's a simple process:

1. Determine what terrain the party is moving through. Most rules systems identify a small handful of terrain; Environmental Encounters differentiates 23 different landscapes, from Lava to Coastal, from Grasslands to Pine Forests.
2. Roll. It's just a d20.
3. Look up the Event, Quirk, Combat Encounter, or type of No Encounter that results. There's over 60 different things that could happen, most with a deep variety of additional permutations and riffs that make for thousands of different possibilities!

The majority of the book is system-agnostic, and can be used easily with any TTRPG system. Some specific tools and elements contain rules language tailored to 5E, Pathfinder, Pathfinder Second Edition (P2E), OSR, and Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC).

What's Included

FlexTal Environmental Encounters features:


36 FlexTables, each four tables in one, covering a wide range of possiblel contexts and 23 terrain types.
49 Tables which add nuance and variability to the results.
27 Event encounters, each a minor setpiece in and of itself.
29 Quirk encounters, designed to add interest but less threat to overland travel.
And much, much more!


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: FlexTale Solo Character Compendium (5e)
boardgame.description:
FlexTale Solo Character Compendium (SCC)

Meant as a companion to the in-development Solo Adventuring Toolkit, it was designed to be a valuable player and GM aid in traditional, social group play as a standalone product.

The SCC contains:


A wealth of guidance on character and party design and advancement
More than 30 ready-to-play, richly-detailed PCs
128 complete statblocks spanning a wide range of difficulty levels
An overview of the FlexAI creature combat behavior rules that have been published in a number of other IGS products already


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: FlexTale Solo Character Compendium (PF)
boardgame.description:
FlexTale Solo Character Compendium (SCC)

Meant as a companion to the in-development Solo Adventuring Toolkit, it was designed to be a valuable player and GM aid in traditional, social group play as a standalone product.

The SCC contains:


A wealth of guidance on character and party design and advancement
More than 30 ready-to-play, richly-detailed PCs
128 complete statblocks spanning a wide range of difficulty levels
An overview of the FlexAI creature combat behavior rules that have been published in a number of other IGS products already


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Mysthea: Monster Sets
boardgame.description:
The Miniature Bundle completes the Monsters Miniatures set in addition to those already included in Mysthea: Essential Edition.

Contents:

3 Additional Monster Miniatures:
Boulron the Reaper
Kodror the Infestation
Obsidusa the Devourer

With related cards and 1 English rulesheet.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mysthea

boardgame.name: Treasured Finds
boardgame.description:
Give your players the loot they deserve! Treasured Finds is the newest bestselling Dungeon Master handbook from Cawood Publishing. There is a lot of great loot in the DMG, now we organized it for you!

This 56-page book is divided into two general sections; Individual Treasure and Treasure Hoards. You can choose loot from the easy-to-use tables or roll for a random selection.

A number of extras are also included:


Magic Items tables for individual NPCs or monsters
Numerous kinds of treasure chests with descriptions and traps
Monster tables to add creatures who could guard the treasure
NPC stat blocks if you want to use them as guardians.
Levels 5 and 10, every class.
Locations table for ideas of where to put the treasure hoards
Containers table, if you don't want to use a treasure chest
Traps and tricks tables
Additional items tables; weapons, armor, adventuring gear, and mundane items


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Cult of Ninkilim
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Ninkilim, one of the most insidious and destructive deities in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
Places where Ninkilim is worshipped
Rites held in Ninkilim's honor
2 New Spells: breath of locust and cicada swarm
Paladin's Oath of the Outcast

boardgame.name: Thay: Land of the Red Wizards
boardgame.description:
Known to the wider Forgotten Realms® as a sinister land
of Red Wizards, slavers, and marching undead armies,
Thay is the distant—or uncomfortably close—menace that
“may become our doom if Szass Tam turns his attention
in our direction.”

And Thay is that, but it is also so much more. A truly
magical land (thanks to a secret that even the goddess
Mystra helps to keep) of rich culture, a rising middle class,
ambitious nobles and Red Wizards who fear Szass Tam
more than they hate him, but may soon be forced to defy
him, and wealth beyond the imaginings of even wealthy
and proud realms elsewhere.

This tome is your guide to the Thay of right now, a
valuable resource for Dungeon Masters and players alike.
It sets forth the people and places of the Land of Red
Wizards, what life is like, and seeds, hints, and secrets
sufficient to spur adventures for years of enjoyment at
your gaming table.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Volo's Vetted Vendors
boardgame.description:
The Best Shops of the Forgotten Realms

Volothamp Geddarm is back! After years of research, Volo’s Vetted Vendors is the humble scribe’s latest work. Wherever your adventures take you, this book will be your guide to the local businesses. Whether you're looking for a place to sleep, somewhere to stock up on supplies, or simply a place to get a great mug of ale, Volo has got you covered!

This book includes 20 unique establishments and their proprietors, together with a list of wares offered, delectable details about the owner, and other adventure seeds to inspire your campaign.

In addition to the full-color 67-page supplement you will also receive:


A printer-friendly version
A separate PDF file with all the monsters used in the supplement
High-Res map of The General Store
The book includes everything you need to effectively (and quickly!) use it at the table. All referenced monsters and items (both magic and mundane!) are listed in the complete appendices, whether you purchase the digital or print version.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Sandwich Guy
boardgame.description:
You are The Sandwich Guy, whose food truck is known far and wide as a premier foodie destination. You're given a non-stop barrage of ingredients, which you use to make sandwiches... of variable quality.

Starting with a hand of eight cards, each turn you choose three cards to discard as a "sandwich." The only rule is that the three must be equally distant from each other (e.g., 2-3-4, or 3-6-9, or 5-5-5, etc.). You then draw a number of cards based on the "quality" of your sandwich: if it all cards discarded were of the same suit, you draw four; if all three were of the same color but two different suits, you draw three (that is, you get back the same amount you discarded); if the cards were of different colors, you only get back two.

The game consists in decisions about when to play certain cards and when to hold on to them, having a good idea of what's left in the deck and what's not, and in keeping your hand size healthy enough to stay in business. If you would draw the last card, you win; if you cannot make a sandwich out of your ingredients, you lose.

The game can be played entirely in-hand, holding the deck of cards with the ingredients on top and the discard pile face-up below.

boardgame.name: Provisions 1849
boardgame.description:
THEME: By the summer of 1849, the California Gold Rush was in full swing. In this fast-moving game, you and your fellow players own competing General Stores in a boomtown where new gold was just discovered. You must battle it out selling specific supplies to the gold prospectors flooding into town. But first you must either buy the goods from local suppliers or trade with a devious gang of vigilantes when supplies become too scarce. And of course, you must move quickly to make your fortune; because in just 6 months, the gold will run out in this town and the prospectors will move on to another!

GAME PLAY: The game is played over 6 Rounds – one for each month from July through December. Each Round has 2 Phases: Production Phase and Buy/Sell/Trade Phase.

During the Production Phase, each of the 8 Suppliers produce Goods (or has Goods stolen by the Vigilantes!). Production is random based on the Production Cards that are chosen each round, so some goods may quickly become scarce!

During the Buy/Sell/Trade Phase, players either buy Goods from the Suppliers, sell the Goods needed by a Prospector to make a sale and claim the Prospector Card, or trade Goods with the Vigilantes.

Some claimed Prospector Cards include a Contract Goods bonus which can be used to make future sales – making this an “engine-building” game!

Play continues for 6 rounds (representing 6 months) with special rules at the end of September when the Vigilantes flee and drop their stolen goods for players to grab, and during the final month of December when the gold has run out and prospectors are stocking up quickly to move on to the next boomtown.

GOAL OF THE GAME: Win the game by collecting the most Provision Points from completed sales to the Prospectors, as well as Bonus Points from individual Bonus objectives achieved at the end of the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Rival Troops
boardgame.description:
In Rival Troops, players explore a campground, adding new sites to the expanding area. Players will move their troops around the board, trying to position themselves in the best sites to set up camp. At the end of the game, players will score points for the sites that they've claimed, as long as they have the majority of troops on a site.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kobolds, Goblins, & Bugbears
boardgame.description:
A Plethora of Content for Even The Most Seasoned Adventurers! Help a bugbear open an inn! Track an old witch's runaway hut! Buy fireworks from a cat-loving goblin! With over 88 pages of content, Not Another Monster Quest is jam packed full of adventures, encounters and NPCs for your players to experience.

4 adventures ranging from Tier 1 to Tier 3.

8 NPCs each with their own rich history and backstory for your players to befriend or earn their ire.

16 colorful encounters ranging from exploration to social and combat. There is something for everyone.

Also included, 17 pieces of original artwork and maps

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Orcs, Gnolls, & Minotaurs
boardgame.description:
A Plethora of Content for Even The Most Seasoned Adventurers! Help a gnoll decipher love notes for a romantic pinicking experience! Enjoy a magical minotaur carnvial complete with maze! Enter an orc wrestling competition! With over 90 pages of content, Not Another Monster Quest is jam packed full of adventures, encounters and NPCs for your players to experience.


4 adventures ranging from Tier 1 to Tier 3.



8 NPCs each with their own rich history and backstory for your players to befriend or earn their ire.



16 colorful encounters ranging from exploration to social or combat. There is something for everyone.



Also included, 24 pieces of original artwork and maps


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Farmen: Kampen for tilværelsen
boardgame.description:
This game is heavily based on the successful show Farmen at TV2's TV-channel.

You play the game by rolling a dice, collecting milkbuckets on your road. After collecting enough milkbuckets you could either spend it on money (buying resources), or buying knifes (counting as points when scoring to win).

boardgame.name: Playing Dead
boardgame.description:
Playing Dead is a complete ruleset for starting (or continuing) your journey as an undead, including new thematic options for class features, subclasses, spells, magic items, and transcending the limits of undeath itself.

A 100-page player’s companion for keeping that favorite character of yours going, even after that unfortunate moment when you forgot to check for traps.

In this supplement, you’ll find everything you need to become an undead character, including:


A new Reanimated Undead trait for your undead player characters.
Detailed guidance on becoming undead and reflavoring your spells and abilities to match.
Variant Class Features for all 13 official classes, purpose-built for your undead character.
20 brand new subclasses, spread over all 13 classes, such as the druid Circle of the Host and the paladin Oath of the Damned.
Prestige Classes/Greater Undeath! Everything you need to play as a fearsome undead creature, including the lich, the revenant, and the vampire!
Dozens of new feats, spells, and magic items too!


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Glitter Grimoire
boardgame.description:
To whomever is reading this message: STOP IMMEDIATELY. DO NOT OPEN THIS BOOK, UNDER PENALTY OF EJECTION FROM CANDLEKEEP.

This "tome" represents nothing but trouble. A collection of some of the most bizarre magic ever created, this "Glitter Grimoire" is a surprisingly powerful tool. The magic contained within must never be unleashed, lest pure chaos overtake the realm. The Grimoire was given to Candlekeep for protection by Elminster himself after what he would refer to only as "the custard pie incident."

The Glitter Grimoire is a powerful arcane spellbook by way of Lisa Frank.

Passed down from mage to mage--including Tasha herself!--the Glitter Grimoire is a spiral-bound notebook* full of over 100 spells and magic items that are funny but useful (and a bunch of doodles, because all the best spellbooks have doodles). Why not cast conjure whoopie cushion? Or mustache you a question? Freaky tenday? How about conjure goodest boy? Trick your players with the deck of many silly things, which seems to all like its more infamous cousin but is actually (relatively) harmless!


(not actually spiral-bound. Some imagination required.) an owlbear riding a donut with a word bubble that reads


Everything in the Glitter Grimoire is designed to be "worth the spell slot." Meaning, nothing here is just a prank... but it can absolutely be used that way! Created by 25 DMs Guild creators, the Glitter Grimoire's magic is sure to spark joy--including a cut-out magic item for you to make yourself!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Dark Quarter: Lost to the Night
boardgame.description:
Thirteen year old Susanna has disappeared without a trace and the NOPD are powerless to find her. A band of misfits, brought together by their connections to Susanna, will do what the police cannot and bring her home!

While not investigators themselves, this group congregates around "The Alligator" club and have seen the dark and magical underbelly of New Orleans with their own eyes. They also know that Susanna might well be connected to the arcane as she is no ordinary teenager.

With Susanna's life on the line, the stakes will be higher and more personal than ever.

What's Inside:

3 feature-length scenarios
30 location tiles
3 scene tiles
21 NPC markers
28 consumable cards
21 story cards


Characters:

Jane 'Bluejay' Tien: The Sister
Hector Zavaleta: The Protector
Fermin 'One-Eye' Lafayette: The Teacher
Evelyn Dansky: The Mother


Each character comes with:

1 character board
1 32mm miniature
9 ability cards
